competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization
                    Type: Knowledge

                    Definition: Definition, Purposes, Indications, Types of catheter, Size of Catheter, Catheter material, General Instructions, Articles Required.

                    This competency assesses:
                    - structural characteristics of an intermittent urinary catheter
- aseptic technique during catheter insertion using sterile gloves drapes and antiseptic
- appropriate clinical indications for performing urinary catheterization
- maximum safe duration a silicone catheter can remain in situ
- the number of lumens present in a straight urinary catheter
- the number of lumens present in a Foley’s urinary catheter
- appropriate catheter size commonly used in male patients
- correct Foley’s catheter size for bladder irrigation
- relationship between catheterization and catheter-associated urinary tract infections
- safe volume of sterile water used to inflate a catheter balloon

                    Activities: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization, Post Quiz

metadata.module_competency_definition: Definition, Purposes, Indications, Types of catheter, Size of Catheter, Catheter material, General Instructions, Articles Required.
metadata.activity_names: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization, Post Quiz

competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure
                    Type: Skill

                    Definition: Introduction to patient, Physician prescription, Explanation of procedure, Position for procedure, Draping of patient,Cleaning of perineal area, Lubrication of the catheter, Insertion of the catheter, Inflation of foley's Catheter ballon, Attachement of urinary bag, Secure the catheter.

                    This competency assesses:
                    - correct nursing action when catheter placement enters the vagina accidentally
- correct sequential steps of the urinary catheterization procedure
- rationale for advancing the catheter further before balloon inflation
- patient responses indicating balloon inflation should be stopped immediately
- correct positioning of a female patient for catheterization
- function of the inflatable balloon in an indwelling catheter

                    Activities: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

metadata.module_competency_definition: Introduction to patient, Physician prescription, Explanation of procedure, Position for procedure, Draping of patient,Cleaning of perineal area, Lubrication of the catheter, Insertion of the catheter, Inflation of foley's Catheter ballon, Attachement of urinary bag, Secure the catheter.
metadata.activity_names: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Male Catheterization
                    Type: Skill

                    Definition: Position of the client, Cleaning of urinary meatus, Lubrication of catheter, Insertion of urinary catheter, Attachement of catheter to urinary bag, Secure the catheter, record the procedure.

                    This competency assesses:
                    - proper foreskin management during male catheterization
- Advances a urinary catheter to the correct anatomical depth in male patients
- purpose of lubrication during male urinary catheter insertion
- lateral fixation of a male indwelling urinary catheter
- nursing interventions that reduce infection risk in urinary retention catheters
- correct position for male urinary catheter insertion
- rationale for keeping the drainage bag below bladder level to prevent infection

                    Activities: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

metadata.module_competency_definition: Position of the client, Cleaning of urinary meatus, Lubrication of catheter, Insertion of urinary catheter, Attachement of catheter to urinary bag, Secure the catheter, record the procedure.
metadata.activity_names: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Catheter care
                    Type: Knowledge

                    Definition: Definition, Articles

                    This competency assesses:
                    - infection-control precautions required during catheter care
- correct principles of routine catheter care

                    Activities: Removal of Indwelling Catheter and Catheter Care, Post Quiz

metadata.activity_names: Removal of Indwelling Catheter and Catheter Care, Post Quiz

competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Catheter care procedure
                    Type: Skill

                    Definition: Identify patient, Explain procedure, Privacy, Position, Hand washing, wear gloves, cleaning of catheter, Cover patient.

                    This competency assesses:
                    - sterile technique while irrigating an indwelling urinary catheter to prevent infection
- safe and hygienic emptying of a urinary drainage bag
- female indwelling catheter care in the correct anatomical sequence

                    Activities: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

metadata.module_competency_definition: Identify patient, Explain procedure, Privacy, Position, Hand washing, wear gloves, cleaning of catheter, Cover patient.
metadata.activity_names: Male and Female Catheterization (Procedure), Post Quiz

competencies.embedding_text:
Competency: Removal of indwelling urinary catheter
                    Type: Skill

                    Definition: Purposes, Identify patient, explain procedure, Provide privacy, Position of patient, Hand wash, Deflate the ballon, Remove catheter, Cover patient, position comfortably, Instruction to patient, Record time

                    This competency assesses:
                    - immediate post-removal assessment of an indwelling urinary catheter
- purpose and function of indwelling urinary catheters
- appropriate and inappropriate indications for removal of an indwelling catheter

                    Activities: Removal of Indwelling Catheter and Catheter Care, Post Quiz

metadata.module_competency_definition: Purposes, Identify patient, explain procedure, Provide privacy, Position of patient, Hand wash, Deflate the ballon, Remove catheter, Cover patient, position comfortably, Instruction to patient, Record time
metadata.activity_names: Removal of Indwelling Catheter and Catheter Care, Post Quiz

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: An intermittent urinary catheter has all the below mentioned characteristic features except-
                        Correct Answer: Made up of latex, silicon
                        Learning Objective: structural characteristics of an intermittent urinary catheter
                        All Options: Made up of latex, silicon | Single lumen straight plastic tube | Presence of opening at the tip of 1.3 cm | It is used for shorter duration of time
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: An intermittent urinary catheter has all the below mentioned characteristic features except-
metadata.options_text: Made up of latex, silicon | Single lumen straight plastic tube | Presence of opening at the tip of 1.3 cm | It is used for shorter duration of time
metadata.correct_option_text: Made up of latex, silicon
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: structural characteristics of an intermittent urinary catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Appropriate insertion follows aseptic technique which includes the use of which of the following?
                        Correct Answer: All of the above
                        Learning Objective: aseptic technique during catheter insertion using sterile gloves drapes and antiseptic
                        All Options: Sterile gloves | Sterile drape sheet | Sterile skin antiseptic | All of the above
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Appropriate insertion follows aseptic technique which includes the use of which of the following?
metadata.options_text: Sterile gloves | Sterile drape sheet | Sterile skin antiseptic | All of the above
metadata.correct_option_text: All of the above
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: aseptic technique during catheter insertion using sterile gloves drapes and antiseptic

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Catheterization is performed for all of the following reasons except?
                        Correct Answer: For relief of urinary suppression with overflow.
                        Learning Objective: appropriate clinical indications for performing urinary catheterization
                        All Options: To check for residual urine | To instill meds into bladder | For relief of bladder distention from urinary retention. | For relief of urinary suppression with overflow.
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Catheterization is performed for all of the following reasons except?
metadata.options_text: To check for residual urine | To instill meds into bladder | For relief of bladder distention from urinary retention. | For relief of urinary suppression with overflow.
metadata.correct_option_text: For relief of urinary suppression with overflow.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: appropriate clinical indications for performing urinary catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: How long can a silicon catheter stay in situ?
                        Correct Answer: 12 weeks
                        Learning Objective: maximum safe duration a silicone catheter can remain in situ
                        All Options: 2 weeks | 12 weeks | 3 weeks | 20 weeks
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: How long can a silicon catheter stay in situ?
metadata.options_text: 2 weeks | 12 weeks | 3 weeks | 20 weeks
metadata.correct_option_text: 12 weeks
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: maximum safe duration a silicone catheter can remain in situ

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: How many lumen does a straight catheter have?
                        Correct Answer: One
                        Learning Objective: the number of lumens present in a straight urinary catheter
                        All Options: Two | Three | One | None
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: How many lumen does a straight catheter have?
metadata.options_text: Two | Three | One | None
metadata.correct_option_text: One
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: the number of lumens present in a straight urinary catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: How many lumens does a Foley catheter have?
                        Correct Answer: 2
                        Learning Objective: the number of lumens present in a Foley’s urinary catheter
                        All Options: 1 | 2 | None
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: How many lumens does a Foley catheter have?
metadata.options_text: 1 | 2 | None
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: the number of lumens present in a Foley’s urinary catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Normally which size of catheter used in a male patient?
                        Correct Answer: 14-18 cm
                        Learning Objective: appropriate catheter size commonly used in male patients
                        All Options: 12-15 cm | 14-18 cm | 20-24 cm | 25-28 cm
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Normally which size of catheter used in a male patient?
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: appropriate catheter size commonly used in male patients

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Ramesh a 32 year old male is admitted in the hospital as a case of hydronephrosis and is advised for bladder irrigation. The size of Foley’s catheter that should be used for catheterizing is –
                        Correct Answer: 14-18 Fr
                        Learning Objective: correct Foley’s catheter size for bladder irrigation
                        All Options: 14-18 Fr | 30-22 Fr | 22-24 Fr | 10-13 Fr
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Ramesh a 32 year old male is admitted in the hospital as a case of hydronephrosis and is advised for bladder irrigation. The size of Foley’s catheter that should be used for catheterizing is –
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct Foley’s catheter size for bladder irrigation

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: State if “True” or “False”. Catheter-associated urinary tract infections are the most common cause of bacteremia (bloodstream infection) in long-term care facilities.
                        Correct Answer: True
                        Learning Objective: relationship between catheterization and catheter-associated urinary tract infections
                        All Options: True | False
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: State if “True” or “False”. Catheter-associated urinary tract infections are the most common cause of bacteremia (bloodstream infection) in long-term care facilities.
metadata.options_text: True | False
metadata.correct_option_text: True
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: relationship between catheterization and catheter-associated urinary tract infections

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The maximum amount of sterile water that can be used to inflate the balloon at the tip of the catheter is
                        Correct Answer: 5-10 ml
                        Learning Objective: safe volume of sterile water used to inflate a catheter balloon
                        All Options: 2 ml | 50 ml | 5-10 ml | 150 ml
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: The maximum amount of sterile water that can be used to inflate the balloon at the tip of the catheter is
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: safe volume of sterile water used to inflate a catheter balloon

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The normal size of catheter used in a female patient is -----------
                        Correct Answer: 12-16 Fr
                        Learning Objective: standard catheter size used in female patients
                        All Options: 6-10 Fr | 12-16 Fr | 16--19 Fr | 20-24 Fr
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: The normal size of catheter used in a female patient is -----------
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: standard catheter size used in female patients

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Urinary catheterization involves inserting the Foley’s catheter
                        Correct Answer: Through the urethra into the bladder
                        Learning Objective: correct anatomical route for Foley’s catheter insertion
                        All Options: Into the ureter | Through the urethra into the bladder | Through the rectum | From ureter into the bladder
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Urinary catheterization involves inserting the Foley’s catheter
metadata.options_text: Into the ureter | Through the urethra into the bladder | Through the rectum | From ureter into the bladder
metadata.correct_option_text: Through the urethra into the bladder
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct anatomical route for Foley’s catheter insertion

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: What is the size of urinary catheter used in children?
                        Correct Answer: 5-12 Fr
                        Learning Objective: appropriate urinary catheter sizes used in children
                        All Options: 5-12 Fr | 12-14 Fr | 14-16 Fr | 18 Fr
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: What is the size of urinary catheter used in children?
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: appropriate urinary catheter sizes used in children

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which among the following sizes of urinary catheter is not used for female patients?
                        Correct Answer: 18 Fr
                        Learning Objective: catheter sizes unsuitable for female patients
                        All Options: 16 Fr | 18 Fr | 12 Fr | 14 Fr
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Which among the following sizes of urinary catheter is not used for female patients?
metadata.options_text: 16 Fr | 18 Fr | 12 Fr | 14 Fr
metadata.correct_option_text: 18 Fr
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: catheter sizes unsuitable for female patients

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which of the following general instructions about catheterization is true
                        Correct Answer: The urobag should always be kept below the level of bladder.
                        Learning Objective: general safety principles related to urinary catheterization
                        All Options: Urobag should be changed every 24 hours | Ringer Lactate should be used to flush the catheter | The urobag should always be kept below the level of bladder. | Sterile technique is not necessary for catheterization
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Which of the following general instructions about catheterization is true
metadata.options_text: Urobag should be changed every 24 hours | Ringer Lactate should be used to flush the catheter | The urobag should always be kept below the level of bladder. | Sterile technique is not necessary for catheterization
metadata.correct_option_text: The urobag should always be kept below the level of bladder.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: general safety principles related to urinary catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which of the following has an inflatable balloon at the tip that helps anchor the catheter in its place
                        Correct Answer: Indwelling catheter
                        Learning Objective: devices containing inflatable balloons for internal anchoring
                        All Options: Ryles tube | Nasogastric tube | Indwelling catheter | Intermittent catheter
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Which of the following has an inflatable balloon at the tip that helps anchor the catheter in its place
metadata.options_text: Ryles tube | Nasogastric tube | Indwelling catheter | Intermittent catheter
metadata.correct_option_text: Indwelling catheter
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: devices containing inflatable balloons for internal anchoring

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which of the following is an indication for urinary catheterization for diagnostic purposes
                        Correct Answer: Imaging studies of UTI
                        Learning Objective: diagnostic indications for urinary catheterization
                        All Options: Imaging studies of UTI | Relieve urinary retention | Instillation of medication | Hydronephrosis
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Which of the following is an indication for urinary catheterization for diagnostic purposes
metadata.options_text: Imaging studies of UTI | Relieve urinary retention | Instillation of medication | Hydronephrosis
metadata.correct_option_text: Imaging studies of UTI
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: diagnostic indications for urinary catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Why are there two lumens in a Foley catheter?
                        Correct Answer: One to drain urine and other to inflate balloon
                        Learning Objective: functional purpose of dual lumens in a Foley catheter
                        All Options: One to drain urine and other to inflate balloon | One to drain urine and other to administer medication | One to administer medication and other to inflate balloon | Both to drain urine
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Why are there two lumens in a Foley catheter?
metadata.options_text: One to drain urine and other to inflate balloon | One to drain urine and other to administer medication | One to administer medication and other to inflate balloon | Both to drain urine
metadata.correct_option_text: One to drain urine and other to inflate balloon
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: functional purpose of dual lumens in a Foley catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: A urine specimen is needed to test for the presence of ketones in a client who is diabetic. What should the nurse do when collecting this specimen from a urinary retention catheter?
                        Correct Answer: Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.
                        Learning Objective: urine specimens aseptically from a retention catheter using the sampling port
                        All Options: Disconnect the catheter and drain the urine into a clean container. | Clean the drainage valve and remove the urine from the catheter bag. | Wipe the catheter with alcohol and drain the urine into a sterile test tube. | Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: A urine specimen is needed to test for the presence of ketones in a client who is diabetic. What should the nurse do when collecting this specimen from a urinary retention catheter?
metadata.options_text: Disconnect the catheter and drain the urine into a clean container. | Clean the drainage valve and remove the urine from the catheter bag. | Wipe the catheter with alcohol and drain the urine into a sterile test tube. | Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.
metadata.correct_option_text: Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: urine specimens aseptically from a retention catheter using the sampling port

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: All the statements about urinary catheterization are true except
                        Correct Answer: It is not an invasive procedure
                        Learning Objective: purpose indications and invasive nature of urinary catheterization
                        All Options: It relieves retention of urine | It is not an invasive procedure | It helps obtain urine sample | It helps in monitoring the urinary output
                        Competency: Introduction to Urinary Catheterization (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: All the statements about urinary catheterization are true except
metadata.options_text: It relieves retention of urine | It is not an invasive procedure | It helps obtain urine sample | It helps in monitoring the urinary output
metadata.correct_option_text: It is not an invasive procedure
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: purpose indications and invasive nature of urinary catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The catheter slips into the vagina during a straight catheterization of a female patient. Which action by the nurse is appropriate?
                        Correct Answer: Leaves the catheter in place and gets a new sterile catheter
                        Learning Objective: correct nursing action when catheter placement enters the vagina accidentally
                        All Options: Removes the catheter and redirects it to the urinary meatus | Removes the catheter, wipes it with a sterile gauze and redirects it to the urinary  meatus | Leaves the catheter in place and gets a new sterile catheter | Leaves the catheter in place and asks another nurse to attempt the procedure
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: The catheter slips into the vagina during a straight catheterization of a female patient. Which action by the nurse is appropriate?
metadata.options_text: Removes the catheter and redirects it to the urinary meatus | Removes the catheter, wipes it with a sterile gauze and redirects it to the urinary  meatus | Leaves the catheter in place and gets a new sterile catheter | Leaves the catheter in place and asks another nurse to attempt the procedure
metadata.correct_option_text: Leaves the catheter in place and gets a new sterile catheter
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct nursing action when catheter placement enters the vagina accidentally

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Identify the correct sequence of procedure for urinary catheterization
                        Correct Answer: Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from outer to inner, insert catheter, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure
                        Learning Objective: correct sequential steps of the urinary catheterization procedure
                        All Options: Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from outer to inner, insert catheter, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure | Drape patient, provide position, clean from inside out, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure | Set up the sterile field, position the patient, clean from inside out, insert catheter, attach and secure | Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from urinary meatus to outside, insert catheter, attach and secure, inflate distal balloon,
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Identify the correct sequence of procedure for urinary catheterization
metadata.options_text: Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from outer to inner, insert catheter, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure | Drape patient, provide position, clean from inside out, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure | Set up the sterile field, position the patient, clean from inside out, insert catheter, attach and secure | Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from urinary meatus to outside, insert catheter, attach and secure, inflate distal balloon,
metadata.correct_option_text: Position appropriately, set up the sterile field, drape the patient, clean from outer to inner, insert catheter, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct sequential steps of the urinary catheterization procedure

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: In the procedure for inserting an indwelling catheter, after urine appears in the tubing, the catheter is advanced additional 2-inches in order to:
                        Correct Answer: Minimize the risk for balloon inflation in the urethra.
                        Learning Objective: rationale for advancing the catheter further before balloon inflation
                        All Options: Minimize the risk for balloon inflation in the urethra. | Increase the amount of urine drained. | Stimulate normal bladder contraction. | Promote Bladder Tone
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: In the procedure for inserting an indwelling catheter, after urine appears in the tubing, the catheter is advanced additional 2-inches in order to:
metadata.options_text: Minimize the risk for balloon inflation in the urethra. | Increase the amount of urine drained. | Stimulate normal bladder contraction. | Promote Bladder Tone
metadata.correct_option_text: Minimize the risk for balloon inflation in the urethra.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: rationale for advancing the catheter further before balloon inflation

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Inflation of the balloon should be withheld if the patient complains of
                        Correct Answer: Severe pain while inflating the balloon
                        Learning Objective: patient responses indicating balloon inflation should be stopped immediately
                        All Options: Severe pain while inflating the balloon | Nausea and vomiting | Incontinence | Bleeding per rectum
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Inflation of the balloon should be withheld if the patient complains of
metadata.options_text: Severe pain while inflating the balloon | Nausea and vomiting | Incontinence | Bleeding per rectum
metadata.correct_option_text: Severe pain while inflating the balloon
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: patient responses indicating balloon inflation should be stopped immediately

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: What position is a female patient in for catheterization?
                        Correct Answer: Dorsal recumbent
                        Learning Objective: correct positioning of a female patient for catheterization
                        All Options: Dorsal recumbent | High fowler | Sims position | Knee chest position
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: What position is a female patient in for catheterization?
metadata.options_text: Dorsal recumbent | High fowler | Sims position | Knee chest position
metadata.correct_option_text: Dorsal recumbent
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct positioning of a female patient for catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The purpose of inflatable balloon at the tip of an indwelling catheter is to-
                        Correct Answer: Hold the catheter in place once inflated
                        Learning Objective: function of the inflatable balloon in an indwelling catheter
                        All Options: Hold the catheter in place once inflated | Give shape to the catheter | Protect the adjacent lying structures | Collect urine specimen
                        Competency: Female Catheterization Procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: The purpose of inflatable balloon at the tip of an indwelling catheter is to-
metadata.options_text: Hold the catheter in place once inflated | Give shape to the catheter | Protect the adjacent lying structures | Collect urine specimen
metadata.correct_option_text: Hold the catheter in place once inflated
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: function of the inflatable balloon in an indwelling catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: What should you do to the foreskin when catheterizing?
                        Correct Answer: Retract it and clean it before catheterization
                        Learning Objective: proper foreskin management during male catheterization
                        All Options: Retract it and clean it before catheterization | never retract the skin
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: What should you do to the foreskin when catheterizing?
metadata.options_text: Retract it and clean it before catheterization | never retract the skin
metadata.correct_option_text: Retract it and clean it before catheterization
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: proper foreskin management during male catheterization

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: How many centimeters should the urinary catheter be advanced in a male?
                        Correct Answer: 15-25 cm
                        Learning Objective: Advances a urinary catheter to the correct anatomical depth in male patients
                        All Options: 5-6 cm | 10-14 cm | 2-5 cm | 15-25 cm
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: How many centimeters should the urinary catheter be advanced in a male?
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: Advances a urinary catheter to the correct anatomical depth in male patients

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The primary reason for lubricating the urinary catheter generously before inserting the catheter into a male client is that this technique helps reduce:
                        Correct Answer: Friction along the urethra when the catheter is being inserted.
                        Learning Objective: purpose of lubrication during male urinary catheter insertion
                        All Options: Spasms at the orifice of the bladder. | Friction along the urethra when the catheter is being inserted. | The number of organisms gaining entrance to the bladder. | The formation of encrustations that may occur at the end of the catheter.
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: The primary reason for lubricating the urinary catheter generously before inserting the catheter into a male client is that this technique helps reduce:
metadata.options_text: Spasms at the orifice of the bladder. | Friction along the urethra when the catheter is being inserted. | The number of organisms gaining entrance to the bladder. | The formation of encrustations that may occur at the end of the catheter.
metadata.correct_option_text: Friction along the urethra when the catheter is being inserted.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: purpose of lubrication during male urinary catheter insertion

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: The primary reason for taping an indwelling catheter laterally to the thigh of a male client is to:
                        Correct Answer: Eliminate pressure at the penoscrotal angle.
                        Learning Objective: lateral fixation of a male indwelling urinary catheter
                        All Options: Eliminate pressure at the penoscrotal angle. | Prevent the catheter from kinking in the urethra. | Prevent accidental catheter removal. | Allow the client to turn without kinking the catheter.
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: The primary reason for taping an indwelling catheter laterally to the thigh of a male client is to:
metadata.options_text: Eliminate pressure at the penoscrotal angle. | Prevent the catheter from kinking in the urethra. | Prevent accidental catheter removal. | Allow the client to turn without kinking the catheter.
metadata.correct_option_text: Eliminate pressure at the penoscrotal angle.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: lateral fixation of a male indwelling urinary catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which nursing action can best prevent infection from a urinary retention catheter?
                        Correct Answer: Cleansing around the meatus routinely
                        Learning Objective: nursing interventions that reduce infection risk in urinary retention catheters
                        All Options: Changing the catheter daily | Encouraging adequate fluids | Irrigating the catheter once daily | Cleansing around the meatus routinely
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Which nursing action can best prevent infection from a urinary retention catheter?
metadata.options_text: Changing the catheter daily | Encouraging adequate fluids | Irrigating the catheter once daily | Cleansing around the meatus routinely
metadata.correct_option_text: Cleansing around the meatus routinely
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: nursing interventions that reduce infection risk in urinary retention catheters

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which position is preferred in male patients to perform catheterization?
                        Correct Answer: Supine position with thighs slightly abducted
                        Learning Objective: correct position for male urinary catheter insertion
                        All Options: Dorsal recumbent with thighs inward rotated | Supine position with thighs slightly abducted | Prone position | Trendelenburg position
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Which position is preferred in male patients to perform catheterization?
metadata.options_text: Dorsal recumbent with thighs inward rotated | Supine position with thighs slightly abducted | Prone position | Trendelenburg position
metadata.correct_option_text: Supine position with thighs slightly abducted
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct position for male urinary catheter insertion

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Why should a catheter drainage bag be kept below the level of the bladder?
                        Correct Answer: It prevents urine from flowing back into the bladder and causing an infection
                        Learning Objective: rationale for keeping the drainage bag below bladder level to prevent infection
                        All Options: It prevents urine from flowing back into the bladder and causing an infection | The bag is likely to leak if it is held higher than the bladder | The tubing can disconnect from the catheter if it is kept higher than the level of the bladder | The tubing may kink and cause safety hazard to the patient
                        Competency: Male Catheterization (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Why should a catheter drainage bag be kept below the level of the bladder?
metadata.options_text: It prevents urine from flowing back into the bladder and causing an infection | The bag is likely to leak if it is held higher than the bladder | The tubing can disconnect from the catheter if it is kept higher than the level of the bladder | The tubing may kink and cause safety hazard to the patient
metadata.correct_option_text: It prevents urine from flowing back into the bladder and causing an infection
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: rationale for keeping the drainage bag below bladder level to prevent infection

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: State if “True” or “False”.During catheter care, gloves only need to be worn if you are emptying the urine drainage bag.
                        Correct Answer: False
                        Learning Objective: infection-control precautions required during catheter care
                        All Options: True | False
                        Competency: Catheter care (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: State if “True” or “False”.During catheter care, gloves only need to be worn if you are emptying the urine drainage bag.
metadata.options_text: True | False
metadata.correct_option_text: False
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: infection-control precautions required during catheter care

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which of the following is true for providing catheter care?
                        Correct Answer: Observe the area for any signs of irritation or problems with the tubing
                        Learning Objective: correct principles of routine catheter care
                        All Options: Clean the only the first 1 to 2 inches of the catheter tubing | Wipe towards the meatus | Use a paper towel to dry the catheter tubing | Observe the area for any signs of irritation or problems with the tubing
                        Competency: Catheter care (Knowledge)

metadata.question_text: Which of the following is true for providing catheter care?
metadata.options_text: Clean the only the first 1 to 2 inches of the catheter tubing | Wipe towards the meatus | Use a paper towel to dry the catheter tubing | Observe the area for any signs of irritation or problems with the tubing
metadata.correct_option_text: Observe the area for any signs of irritation or problems with the tubing
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: correct principles of routine catheter care

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: A nurse is caring for a client with an indwelling urinary catheter. What is the most important action for the nurse to implement when irrigating the bladder?
                        Correct Answer: Use sterile equipment.
                        Learning Objective: sterile technique while irrigating an indwelling urinary catheter to prevent infection
                        All Options: Use sterile equipment. | Instill the fluid under high pressure. | Warm the solution to body temperature. | Aspirate immediately to ensure return flow.
                        Competency: Catheter care procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: A nurse is caring for a client with an indwelling urinary catheter. What is the most important action for the nurse to implement when irrigating the bladder?
metadata.options_text: Use sterile equipment. | Instill the fluid under high pressure. | Warm the solution to body temperature. | Aspirate immediately to ensure return flow.
metadata.correct_option_text: Use sterile equipment.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: sterile technique while irrigating an indwelling urinary catheter to prevent infection

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: How should a drainage bag be emptied?
                        Correct Answer: Into a measuring jug and then poured into the toilet
                        Learning Objective: safe and hygienic emptying of a urinary drainage bag
                        All Options: Into a pitcher and poured down the sink | Into a measuring jug and then poured into the toilet | Drained directly into a 24-hr specimen container | Disconnected from the catheter tubing and released directly into the toilet
                        Competency: Catheter care procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: How should a drainage bag be emptied?
metadata.options_text: Into a pitcher and poured down the sink | Into a measuring jug and then poured into the toilet | Drained directly into a 24-hr specimen container | Disconnected from the catheter tubing and released directly into the toilet
metadata.correct_option_text: Into a measuring jug and then poured into the toilet
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: safe and hygienic emptying of a urinary drainage bag

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: In a female patient with indwelling catheter the catheter care should be performed in which of the following correct sequence
                        Correct Answer: Urinary meatus, labia minora, labia majora, catheter
                        Learning Objective: female indwelling catheter care in the correct anatomical sequence
                        All Options: Urinary meatus, labia minora, labia majora, catheter | Catheter, urinary meatus, labia majora, labia minora | Urobag, catheter, labia majora | Labia minora, labia majora, perineum, catheter
                        Competency: Catheter care procedure (Skill)

metadata.question_text: In a female patient with indwelling catheter the catheter care should be performed in which of the following correct sequence
metadata.options_text: Urinary meatus, labia minora, labia majora, catheter | Catheter, urinary meatus, labia majora, labia minora | Urobag, catheter, labia majora | Labia minora, labia majora, perineum, catheter
metadata.correct_option_text: Urinary meatus, labia minora, labia majora, catheter
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: female indwelling catheter care in the correct anatomical sequence

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: What should a nurse do immediately after an indwelling catheter is removed?
                        Correct Answer: Observe the catheter for any sediments, mucous or blood
                        Learning Objective: immediate post-removal assessment of an indwelling urinary catheter
                        All Options: Rinse it and send for sterilization | Observe the catheter for any sediments, mucous or blood | Cut and discard in the appropriate color coded bin | Document the procedure
                        Competency: Removal of indwelling urinary catheter (Skill)

metadata.question_text: What should a nurse do immediately after an indwelling catheter is removed?
metadata.options_text: Rinse it and send for sterilization | Observe the catheter for any sediments, mucous or blood | Cut and discard in the appropriate color coded bin | Document the procedure
metadata.correct_option_text: Observe the catheter for any sediments, mucous or blood
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: immediate post-removal assessment of an indwelling urinary catheter

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: lndwelling catheters are designed to:
                        Correct Answer: Rest securely in the bladder for a limited amount of time.
                        Learning Objective: purpose and function of indwelling urinary catheters
                        All Options: Use for straight cath to obtain a urine specimen | Use for a patient who is incontinent | Has no balloon for securing in the bladder | Rest securely in the bladder for a limited amount of time.
                        Competency: Removal of indwelling urinary catheter (Skill)

metadata.question_text: lndwelling catheters are designed to:
metadata.options_text: Use for straight cath to obtain a urine specimen | Use for a patient who is incontinent | Has no balloon for securing in the bladder | Rest securely in the bladder for a limited amount of time.
metadata.correct_option_text: Rest securely in the bladder for a limited amount of time.
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: purpose and function of indwelling urinary catheters

mcqs.embedding_text:
Question: Which among these is not the indication for removal of an indwelling catheter:
                        Correct Answer: Promote incontinence
                        Learning Objective: appropriate and inappropriate indications for removal of an indwelling catheter
                        All Options: Promote normal bladder function | Prevent infection | Prevent trauma to urethra | Promote incontinence
                        Competency: Removal of indwelling urinary catheter (Skill)

metadata.question_text: Which among these is not the indication for removal of an indwelling catheter:
metadata.options_text: Promote normal bladder function | Prevent infection | Prevent trauma to urethra | Promote incontinence
metadata.correct_option_text: Promote incontinence
metadata.question_id_competency_definition: appropriate and inappropriate indications for removal of an indwelling catheter

checklists.embedding_text:
Procedural Checklist: Perform the Urinary Catheterization procedure checklist in the correct sequence.
                        Competency: Procedural Skills (Skill)
                        Correct sequence (11 steps):
                        1. Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
2. Explained the procedure to the patient to gain co-operation. Assembled the articles near the bedside
3. Provided privacy. Washed hands & put on sterile gloves
4. Cleaned the perineum using antiseptic lotion with forceps. One stroke from up to down with one gauze
5. Opened outer plastic cover of the catheter in such a way that inner cover is not contaminated and slide it into the catheterization pack
6. Instructed patient to take a deep breath and relax. Inserted the catheter about  5 to 7.5cms
7. If retention catheter is required, introduced sterile distilled water into inflate the balloon
8. Pulled the catheter slightly outward to ascertain stability
9. Connected the urobag for continuous urinary drainage and kept below the level of bladder
10. Checked the colour of the urine. Make the patient comfortable and replaced the equipment
11. Recorded the colour, amount and any abnormality of urine

metadata.question_text: Perform the Urinary Catheterization procedure checklist in the correct sequence.

Assembled the articles near the bedside"}, {"step_number": 3, "step_text": "Provided privacy. Washed hands & put on sterile gloves"}, {"step_number": 4, "step_text": "Cleaned the perineum using antiseptic lotion with forceps. One stroke from up to down with one gauze"}, {"step_number": 5, "step_text": "Opened outer plastic cover of the catheter in such a way that inner cover is not contaminated and slide it into the catheterization pack"}, {"step_number": 6, "step_text": "Instructed patient to take a deep breath and relax. Inserted the catheter about  5 to 7.5cms"}, {"step_number": 7, "step_text": "If retention catheter is required, introduced sterile distilled water into inflate the balloon"}, {"step_number": 8, "step_text": "Pulled the catheter slightly outward to ascertain stability"}, {"step_number": 9, "step_text": "Connected the urobag for continuous urinary drainage and kept below the level of bladder"}, {"step_number": 10, "step_text": "Checked the colour of the urine. Make the patient comfortable and replaced the equipment"}, {"step_number": 11, "step_text": "Recorded the colour, amount and any abnormality of urine"}]
